DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine early initiation oral ( mouth oppose tube ) feed premature infant result earlier attainment full oral feeding and/or discharge .
DOC.brief_title: Initiation Oral Feeding 30 Versus 33 Weeks Postmenstrual Age
DOC.detailed_description: Infants enrol randomize 30 0/7 week postmenstrual age . The Earlier Oral Feeding group initiate oral feeding 30 0/7 week postmenstrual age . The Later Oral Feeding group initiate oral feeding 33 0/7 week postmenstrual age . The number oral feeding attempt advance accord feed progression protocol group . Successful completion feeding define oral completion full volume feed within 30 minute , without bradycardic episode ( heart rate < 100 beat per minute ) desaturation ( oxygen saturation decrease > 5 % baseline value ) . If infant successfully complete > 95 % total prescribed volume feeding , remainder volume supply via gastric tube . All oral feeding perform bedside nurse , parent observation nursing staff , continuous cardiorespiratory pulse oximetry monitoring . Individual oral feeding attempt group continue one follow occurs despite appropriate pace feeding : 1 ) feeding complete 2 ) feed duration 30 minute 3 ) adverse event feed [ multiple bradycardic episode ( 3 episode heart rate < 100 beat per minute ) , bradycardia choking episode , single severe bradycardia ( heart rate < 60 ) ] . If infant experience adverse event oral feeding attempt , oral feeding attempt hold 2 day .
DOC.criteria: Gestational age < = 29 week birth Tolerating enteral feeding least 3 day 30 week postmenstrual age Neurologic , cardiac , respiratory , gastrointestinal disorder interfere oral feeding
